column2: A and B started a partnership business investing in the ratio of 3 : 8. C joined them after 4 months with an amount equal to 3/4th of B. What was their profit (in Rs) at the end of the year, if C got Rs. 24,000 as his share?

column2: A and B invest in a business in the ratio 4 ∶ 5. After 10 months B leaves the business after withdrawing his investment. In the first year the business made a profit of Rs 49,000. What is B's share (in Rs) of this profit?

column2: Working together A and B can do a job in 40 days, B and C in 36 days and all three together in 24 days. In how many days can B alone do the job?
column8:
Suppose total work = 360 (LCM of 40, 36 & 24)
∴ Efficiency of (A + B) = 360/40 = 9 ---- (1)
Efficiency of (B + C) = 360/36 = 10 ---- (2)
Efficiency of (A + B + C) = 360/24 = 15 ---- (3)
Subtracting equation 1 from 3;
Efficiency of C = 15 – 9 = 6
From equation 2;
Efficiency of B = 10 – 6 = 4
∴ Time taken by B to do the work alone = 360/4 = 90 days

column2: A, B and C can do a job working alone in 50, 75 and 20 days respectively. They all work together for 4 days, then C quits. How many days will A and B take to finish the rest of the job?
column8:
Suppose unit work = 300 units (LCM of 50, 75 & 20)
∴ Work done by A in one day = 300/50 = 6
Work done by B in one day = 300/75 = 4
Work done by C in one day = 300/20 = 15
∴ Work done by (A + B + C) in 4 days = 4 × (6 + 4 + 15) = 100
C quits after 4 days.
∴ Remaining work after 4 days = 300 – 100 = 200 units
∴ Time taken by A and B together to complete 200 units = 200/(6 + 4) = 20 days

column2: A can do 50% of the job in 16 days, B can do 1/4th of the job in 24 days. In how many days can they do 3/4<sup>th</sup> of the job working together?
column8:
Time taken by A to complete the work alone = 16/0.5 = 32 days
Time taken by B to complete the work alone = 24/(1/4) = 96 days
∴ Time taken by A and B together to complete the work = 1/(1/32 + 1/96) = 96/4 = 24 days
∴ Time taken by them together to complete 3/4th of the work = 24 × 3/4 = 18 days

column2: A and B can together complete a task in 18 hours. After 6 hours A leaves. B takes 36 hours to finish rest of the task. How many hours would A have taken to do the task, if he worked alone?
column8:
Fraction of work done by A & B together in 6 hours = 6/18 = 1/3rd
After 6 hours, A left.
Remaining work = 1 – 1/3 = 2/3rd
Since B takes 36 hours to do remaining 2/3rd work;
∴ Time is taken by B to complete the work alone = 36 × 3/2 = 54 hours
∴ Time taken by A to complete the work if done alone = 1/(1/18 – 1/54) = 54/2 = 27 hours
Alternate Method
Let the efficiency of A be x
Let the efficiency of B be y
Work done by A and B together in one day = x + y
Total work = Efficiency × times
⇒ 18(x + y) ----(i)
Work done by (A + B) in 6 days = 6(x + y)
Work done by B in 36 days = 36y
Total work = 6(x + y) + 36y
⇒ 6x + 42y ----(ii)
From equation (i) and (ii)
⇒ 18x + 18y = 6x + 42y
⇒ 12x = 24y
⇒ x ∶ y = 2 ∶ 1
Efficiency of A = x = 2
Efficiency of B = y = 1
Total work = 18(x + y) = 54
Time is taken by A to finish the work alone = 54/2 = 27 days
∴ Time taken by A to finish the work alone is 27 days
Shortcut Trick
A and B complete the work in 18 days.
Both work together for 6 days.
Completed work = 6/18
⇒ Completed work = 1/3
⇒ Remaining work = 2/3
B complete remaining work in 36 days, then total work completed by alone
⇒ 2B/3 = 36
⇒ B = 54 days
Now A alone can complete the work
⇒ A + B = 18 days, B = 54 Days

⇒ A = 54/(3-1)
⇒ A = 27 days
∴ A complete the work alone in 27 days.

column2: 1 packet of biscuits costs Rs. 16, but a pack of 4 of the same packet of biscuits costs Rs. 56. What is the effective discount (in %) on the pack?

column2: The cost price of an article is Rs. x. It is marked up by 200%. It is sold at Rs. 540 after giving 25% discount. What is the value of x (in Rs.)?

column2: A Rs. 750 tin of cheese is offered at 8% discount and a Rs. 1,250 tin of butter at 20% discount. If we buy 5 tins of cheese and 3 tins of butter, what is the effective discount we get (in %)?
column8:

Total selling price after discount = (5 × 750 × 0.92 + 3 × 1250 × 0.8) = 3450 + 3000 = Rs. 6450
∴ Total discount = 7500 – 6450 = Rs. 1050
∴ Effective discount = (1050/7500) × 100 = 14%

column2: The selling price of an article is Rs. 816. The discount on it is 15%. What would be the selling price of the article (in Rs.) if the discount on it is 25%?
column8:
Given:
Selling Price = Rs. 816
Discount% = 15%
Formula:
S.P = M.P(100 - D)/100
Where,
S.P = Selling Price
M.P = Marked Price
D = Discount%
Calculation:
Let the marked price of the article be x
S.P = M.P(100 - D)/100
⇒ 816 = x(100 - 15)/100
⇒ 816 = 0.85x
⇒ x = 816/0.85
M.P = Rs. 960
According to the question:
If the discount is 25% then the selling price will be,
⇒ S.P = 960 × (100 - 25)/100
⇒ S.P = 960 × 75/100 = Rs. 720
∴ The selling price of the article will be Rs. 720, when the discount is 25%.
Alternate Method
Let Marked price be Rs. a
From the problem statement
⇒ a – 0.15a = 816
⇒ a = 816/.85 = 960
SP after 25% discount = 0.75 × 960 = 720
∴ The selling price of the article will be Rs. 720, when the discount is 25%.

column2: Rs. 11,550 has to be divided between X, Y & Z such that X gets 4/5 of what Y gets and Y gets 2/3 of what Z gets. How much more does Z get over X (in Rs.)?

column2: Before a battle the ratio of tanks to planes in an army was 5 : 3. During the war 1000 tanks were destroyed and 800 planes were destroyed. The ratio of tanks to planes became 2 : 1. What is the number of tanks after the war?

⇒ 5x – 1000 = 6x – 1600
∴ x = 600
∴ Number of tanks after war = 600 × 5 – 1000 = 2000

column2: A batsman scores 87 runs in the 21<sup>st</sup> match of his career. His average runs per match increases by 2. What was his average before the 21<sup>st</sup> match?

column2: Oil, equal to 20% of the weight of groundnut, is extracted in a mill. The matter left after extraction is sold as cattle feed at the rate of Rs. 12.5/kg. ∴ Remaining amount to be received by selling oil = 3000 – 1000 = Rs. 2000
Since weight of oil = 100 × 0.2 = 20 litres
∴ Selling cost of oil = 2000/20 = Rs. 100 per liter

column2: On a certain item profit is 150%. If the cost price increases by 25%, what will be the new profit margin (in %)?

⇒ SP = 100 + (150/100) × (100) = 250
Now if CP increased by 25%
⇒ CP = 100 + (25/100) × 100 = 125
Profit can be given as
⇒ (250 – 125) × 100/125 = 100%
∴ Final profit percentage is 100%

that means,

500 - 200 = 300

New CP = 200 + 25% of 200 = 250
New Profit = 500 - 250 = 250
New Profit% = (250/250) × 100 = 100%

column2: A racing car going at an average speed of 108 km/hr takes 15 minutes to complete a lap on a racing track. By how much should it increase its speed (in km/hr) to complete the lap in 12 minutes?

column2: Train A takes 45 minutes more than train B to travel a distance of 450 km. Due to engine trouble, the speed of train B falls by a quarter and it takes 30 minutes more than Train A to complete the same journey. What is the speed of Train A (in km/hr)?
column8:
Shortcut Trick
Partial speed concept:
⇒ [ (S1 × S2) / (S1 - S2) ] × (T2 - T1) = Distance
Let the original speed of B = x km/hr = S1
New speed of B = 3x/4 km/hr = S2
time difference = T2 - T1 = 45 - (-30) = 75 minutes = 1.25 hours
So,
⇒ [ (x × 3x/4) / (x - 3x/4) ] × (1.25) = 450
⇒ 3x × (5/4) = 450
⇒ x = 120 km/hr
So, the time taken by B = 450/120 = 3.75 hours = 3 hours + 45 minutes
So, the time taken by A = 3 hours + 45 minutes + 45 minutes = 4.5 hours
So.
Speed of A = 450/4.5 = 100 km/hr
Alternate Method
Let speed of A = A km/hr and speed of B = B km/hr
According to the question;
⇒ 450/A – 450/B = 45/60
⇒ (1/A – 1/B) = 1/600 ---- (1)
And
⇒ 450/(3B/4) – 450/A = 30/60
⇒ 4/3B – 1/A = 1/900 ---- (2)
Adding both the equations;
⇒ 4/3B – 1/B = 1/600 + 1/900
⇒ 1/3B = 5/1800
⇒ B = 120 km/hr
Putting this value in equation 1;
⇒ 1/A = 1/600 + 1/120 = 6/600
⇒ A = 100 km/hr
∴ Speed of A = 100 km/hr

column2: Two cars A and B travel from one city to another, at speeds of 72 km/hr and 90 km/hr respectively. If car B takes 1 hour lesser than car A for the journey, then what is the distance (in km) between the two cities?
column8:

From the problem statement
⇒ 72x = 90(x – 1)
⇒ x = 5 hrs
Distance between cities = 72 × 5 = 360 kms
∴ Distance between A and B is 360 kms.

column2: B starts 4 minutes after A from the same point, for a place at a distance of 7 miles from the starting point. A on reaching the destination turns back and walks a mile where he meets B. If A's speed is a mile in 8 minutes then B's speed is a mile in ____ minutes.
column8:
Speed of A = 1/8 miles/min
Suppose speed of B = x miles/min.
According to the question, A walked (7 + 1) = 8 miles before meeting B in his return path, so B would have walked (7 – 1) = 6 miles before meeting but B walked 4 minutes less than A.
⇒ 8/(1/8) = 6/x + 4
⇒ 64 = 6/x + 4
x = 1/10
∴ Speed of B = 1/10 miles/min
∴ B’s speed is a mile in 10 minutes.

column2: What is the rate of interest (in %) if simple interest earned on a certain sum for the 3rd year is Rs. 2,000 and compound interest earned in 2 years is Rs. 4,160?
column8:
SI for 3rd year = Rs. 2000
SI for every year will remain same as Rs. 2000
And SI in 2 years = 2000 + 2000 = Rs. 4000
Since CI in 2 years = Rs. 4160
∴ (CI – SI) in two years = 4160 – 4000 = Rs. 160
Since this difference is the interest on interest of 1st year;
∴ 160 = 2000 × r/100
⇒ r = 8%
